NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Brooklyn Chophouse Review  I recently dined at Brooklyn Chophouse, and while the service and ambiance were on point, the food itself left much to be desired. The staff was attentive and friendly, making the experience smooth from start to finish. The restaurant‚Äôs vibe was modern and upscale, with a comfortable atmosphere that‚Äôs perfect for a night out.  Unfortunately, the food didn‚Äôt quite live up to the expectations set by the atmosphere or the price. The dishes were just okay‚Äînot bad, but certainly not worth the premium price tag. For a place that positions itself as a high-end dining experience, the flavors and quality fell flat. While I appreciated the overall experience, I would have expected a higher level of culinary excellence given the cost.  In summary: great service, nice ambiance, but the food was underwhelming and overpriced.

REVIEW: In my opinion, this place is way overrated for what you receive and for the quality and taste of food you received. I ordered the dry aged tomahawk steak. The meat was chewy, fatty  and unseasoned. Seemed like they just threw salt and pepper on the steak, which I can do at home and put it on my grill and get the same taste without the $159 bill. The mashed potatoes were good and so were the onion rings. We were told by the waiter that we had to order all courses up front which I found ridiculous. They don't give you bread or anything to nibble on while you're waiting for your food. To seat four people they actually take two small tables and put them together leaving a space in the middle in which my drink fell over once the waiter put it on the table. The drink was replaced but you would think for these prices they would have two people and four people tables. Anyway, needless to say I will not be going back to this establishment. I am a foodie and taste is everything to me and for the $410.00 that I spend for 2 people, which I don't mind but this place was no thrill at all.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I recently dined at Brooklyn chophouse, enticed by its promising reputation and inviting ambiance. However, my experience was a mixed bag, leaving me with conflicting impressions.  Upon entering, I was greeted warmly by the staff, setting a positive tone for the evening. The atmosphere was charming, with cozy lighting and tasteful decor, creating an inviting ambiance for a relaxed dining experience.  However, my expectations took a slight dip when the food arrived. While the dishes were decent, they fell short of the culinary excellence I had anticipated. The flavors were satisfactory, but lacked the depth and innovation I had hoped for. Each bite left me craving a bit more excitement and creativity on the plate.  On the bright side, the service was good throughout the meal. The staff was attentive and courteous, ensuring that our needs were met with efficiency and a genuine smile. Their hospitality certainly added a layer of enjoyment to the overall experience.  In summary, Brooklyn chophouse offers a pleasant environment and commendable service, but falls short of delivering the exceptional culinary experience I had anticipated. While the food was satisfactory, it lacked the wow factor that would elevate it to a memorable dining experience.

Midweek, place basically empty, early dining time so there would be no imminent rush.  Told by wait staff we had to order apps and mains at the same time.  Never heard of such, especially during a non volume time.  So‚Ä¶  We only ordered apps and drinks and left.  Had we had entrees too according to our initial plan,  they would have made more money and I would be complimenting steaks perhaps.  The prices for steaks seemed high, but apps were great.

REVIEW: It was nice, I took my girlfriend to celebrate her birthday. The food and drinks were awesome. The host said Happy birthday to my girlfriend and recommended some of the great options on the menu. However, they didn't bring out any birthday cake at all with sparkling candles or anything. NAME: OpenTable Diner

It was a bit of a wait for our order to be taken and a wait for the food to come out ( It was worth the wait)  Would strongly suggest you order appetizers.   The table to the left and right of us experience.  Yes we were that close that we engaged in conversations with them since they heard each other‚Äôs conversation.   I frequent this restaurant.   Some of my guests prefer seating at the bar for a verity of reasons and from my experience I will suggest a table if with a lady; the bar with a man

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Reservation was at 7:30, didn‚Äôt get food until 9pm.

NAME: ElaineC
REVIEW: Pork soup dumplings and French onion dumplings AAAAAMAZING!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food was amazing . However the reception staff and the managers were terrible . We had a reservation at 9 . Part of our group was there by 8:50 . Then the rest of the party came in at 9:08. We were asked to wait at the bar until our party arrived . When our full party arrived we made them aware . They came to the bar hastily and said please close out your tab so you can be seated . The tan was closed however we did not get seated until 9:55 pm . We were pressed for time as we had a show to catch . When we tried to get some kind of clarification they were so short dismissive and rude . 3 other tables were seated before us . On top of there were multiple tables empty. It was just such a bad first experience . However the food was very good . Along with our waiter . But based off that i would not step foot back in that restaurant. The way we were dismissed was just insane

NAME: dpNYC
REVIEW: I don't think the fusion of Chinese, Steak and Seafood worked very well.  Too many things happening.  Individually, the food was pretty good.  Service was good, but a place with prices like this, you should have printed menus and leftovers should be boxed for you.  Scanning a QR code for an $89 steak just doesn't make sense.  And dropping a bunch of boxes on our table to box up our own food is not representative of fine dining.

NAME: MarioL
REVIEW: My partner and I went for restaurant week this year. The place had a lovely ambience with a classic downtown Manhattan feel. Low lighting, quiet music in the background and a feel of a great night out. However, the food quantity we received and for the value was not up to par. The filet minon beef and broccoli should just be called beef and broccoli. Growing up in New York my whole life, I would much rather order from any random Chinese restaurant. The bacon cheeseburger dumplings were not to my personal liking, but the bok choy side was delicious. Overall with drinks and tip, the bill came out to $180 during restaurant week, meaning this would‚Äôve been a $250 plus dinner on a normal night, and for that price, I would not recommend this place at all.

NAME: MatthewB
REVIEW: Drinks were good, and place is like the photos. The food was not great. 'Chicken Satay' as they call it was odd and nothing like traditional (carrot pure breaded). Most of the food was too sweet.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Incredible dumplings and presentation was elevated!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I arrived at my reservation time and was immediately sat down and showed where to locate the menu using the QR code. However, everything from there was horrible. I had been sat 15 mins and my waiter had not showed up to introduce themselves and see what I needed. After 15 mins, I flagged the waiter walking past me and after stating that I had been waiting for someone to come so I can order / be acknowledged, he responded ‚ÄúI guess I can serve you‚Äù. Before he walked away I placed my drink order, and it arrived after 5 mins, but I didn‚Äôt see my waiter again. I eventually had to ask another person to find my waiter so I could order food.  This is super disappointing because this was my first experience at this restaurant and it‚Äôs unlikely that I will return. I showed up as a party of one, and that was probably my mistake. The other tables with larger parties and couples together had no issue being served. I dine out often alone and did not feel seen or that my experience was just as important as the others from this experience. The waiter was not warm and I had to seek him to get anything. What makes this experience even worse is that I was right in front of the restaurant, near where the waiters based by frequently for materials, so I would have expected for the service to be quicker.  Additionally, my food came out fairly quick. I ordered the shrimp friend rice, chicken wontons & spring roll with two drinks. The rice and wontons were good but the spring rolls taste as if they were fried in old grease and the drinks were not strong. I didn‚Äôt bring any of this up to my waiter because I was ready to go and just wanted to pay to leave. This experience ruined my entire night and I decided to call it a night early.

NAME: CristalR
REVIEW: The lobster satay blew me out my seat. Everything was good, but that particular dish, will have me coming back! If you‚Äôre a foodie this is place is a must.

Yet, Alex was kind, patient and accommodating, allowing my mother to exchange a drink she didn‚Äôt like the taste of. The food was fresh, hot and tasty. We had the Bass, 9 shrimp, Beijing chicken and short ribs. For sides we had veggie fried rice, white rice (came with the Beijing chicken) and bok choy. Everything was so good. Would recommend to others. Make an reservation and enjoy your night out!

We had to actually assemble our own wedge salad, and the onion rings and mushrooms had no seasoning whatsoever. The service was very slow. We only saw our waiter twice the entire visit. The price was fine for the portion sizes, but that‚Äôs sort of the problem too. The smallest steak was 16 oz, way too large for an average eater. We ended up splitting a larger steak, which was excellent, but also noticed every other table around us had ‚Äúto go‚Äù boxes.  We won‚Äôt be making a return visit here.

REVIEW: It‚Äôs on the louder end because people are enjoying themselves and having a great time and vibing. Let them. I ordered the spicy watermelon margarita - delicious - and the porterhouse Pittsburgh style and it was perfectly charred and salted with a medium to medium rare center. The steaks are more expensive here than I‚Äôm used to at traditional steakhouses so we did not get a side.

NAME: JulieR
REVIEW: If it‚Äôs one thing I had to recommend off the menu. GET THE LAMB CHOPS! I will definitely be back.

NAME: StephanieJ
REVIEW: This was my first time at Brooklyn Chop House.  The food is a unique blend of steakhouse with Asian fusion.  Be advised that the portions are quite large and intended to be shared.  This is true for appetizers, entrees and sides.  The appetizers were great...the crab soup dumplings, french onion soup dumplings, and reuben dumplings were unexpected and interesting combinations of ingredients and absolutely tasty.  The scallion pancakes (and the dipping sauce) were unexpectedly delicious for such a simple dish. The steaks were well cooked and properly seasoned. We had the surf and turf; the garlic lobster tails were fantastic and the filet was so tender. The sides were also very tasty.  We ordered the mushrooms, the broccoli, and the mashed potatoes.  An overall great experience with attentive and personable staff from the time we walked in through our departure.  Definitely a treat, but prepare yourself for the cost.

NAME: NikkiB
REVIEW: I appreciate the noise level being low. The food was amazing as always.

NAME: OpenTable Diner

Drinks were okay but not up to the price being charged.  The chicken saut√© was ok.and nothing to brag about.  I would recommend ordering something else. Steak and lobster were very very good!  They nailed the seasoning on the steak and medium rare was actually medium rare which was on spot. I would not recommend the lobster with the ginger sauce but it wasn‚Äôt bad.  I just could have used something additional In the flavor department. Garlic ginger mashed potatoes were pretty good.  Order the steak.  And the service was awesome!  Environment was good and people were friendly.

NAME: melonieb
REVIEW: Overall excellent service and the food was delicious.

NAME: RandyL

A "Chop" house with a asian flair might of been better (food was pretty good) but they make you order everything all at once (so you over order) and then after the appitziers they brought the soup, salads and dinner all at the same time (weird).  Very obvious the server and likley her management has never been to a fine "Chop" house before.  Also, only about 30% full which is weird in NYC on a Wednesday night.  And, the wine list is very small for a "Chop" house and the years of the wine listed they did not have for the two bottles we ordered.

At no time was it acknowledged by them that they were aware. There was no reference to my son‚Äôs birthday at all. Food was bland. Food overpriced. Music was great and not loud. Staff collecting plates were nice. Our waitress not so much. Travelled from England and felt that we had to come to this restaurant but was extremely disappointed.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Celebrating my daughter 21st birthday was special and that was all due to our Amazing services by Emilio. He was so welcoming and generous with taking our drinks ,and food orders also singing happy birthday. All the Food was delicious!!! they best garlic broccoli you‚Äôll ever eat !!

Not unusual for a Friday night in NYC, but the reason stated was new, the waiters are only allowed to place one food order per table.  We were about to leave to go to a local bar to get a predinner drink when the hostess seated us.  We were told by the waiter that we need to order all food at once.  We did as we were told ordering several very unique dumpling appetizers and steaks.  I specifically requested the appetizers come out first, I was told that would not be an issue.  About 20 minutes later our steaks came out without appetizer.   Our waiter was upset and was in the process of taking them back to await our appetizers.  Not wanting cold or over cook steaks, we decided to skip the appetizers.  Again, the steaks and sides were excellent, but if you are looking for a muti course dinner, maybe look elsewhere.

REVIEW: Update: Someone named Christina reached out to me because of my review. She asked me to reach out to her email and I did this past Tuesday. (Feb 28/ today is Mar 5th) Never heard back from herüòÇSome service this place has. Pretty incredible. Anyway, my feelings are even more solidified and judging by Instagram and TikTok followers they agree with my original review, which you can read below:  Waiter rushed us along. Food was not very good at all. We heard amazing things, which is why we chose it but, we won‚Äôt return. We were supposed to come back with my sister and her husband but I told them not to bother.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Me and my little sis had been looking forward to dining at the Brooklyn chop house for months. I booked a reservation months in advance to celebrate our February birthdays. I requested a half booth in the reservation ‚Äúspecial request ‚Äú section. Our reservation was at 6pm we arrived at 5pm. We were willing to wait to be seated because we were a hour early. One of the hostess decides to seat us early. She puts me and my sis at a small table between two couples. Immediately I request a half booth because it was a cramped space and even my sis who is slender was extremely uncomfortable. The hostess insists that because it‚Äôs only two of us we cannot get a half booth. She informs us that we can wait for the same size table to become available in a different area. She tells us to wait at the bar. At this point I‚Äôm ready to leave and write a scathing review on yelp , the bartender asks us if we would like to speak to the manager. The gracious manager not only seats us promptly but we have one of the best tables in the house. We were sat at a long booth with two tables push together to make one table. The ill mannered hostess kept staring at us but we ignored her and had an amazing meal. We also noticed that the hostess just wanted to be difficult with us for whatever reason because later two couples were seated near us both in half booths. So she lied about the reason why we couldn‚Äôt have one in the first place smh anyways. Our waiter was awesome she gave us top recommendations on what to order. Everything was delicious but the star of the meal was definitely the ginger mashed potatoes which I ordered with sweet and sour chicken. The ginger beef noodles and the short rib bao buns were a close second in rank. They gave us each a slice of red velvet cake to wish us a happy birthday I‚Äôm not a red velvet fan but the cake was tasty as well. The place is expensive but you‚Äôre paying for an experience so it‚Äôs to be expected. I recommend going beware of the weird hostess.

NAME: Jamigon

The service is phenomenal; from the moment I walked in with my fianc√©, we were greeted and accommodated as if we were regulars.  Boukary was our waiter, and I was extremely impressed with his service. He made sure we were well taken care of. Provided suggestions on what sides pair well with the steak I ordered. Biggest plus point= without me telling him, he caught my fianc√© mentioning that it was her birthday and he made sure to bring out a dessert to sing a birthday song. My fianc√© was impressed that I never left the table so she did not expect this surprise, thank you Boukary and staff; I'll be coming back again with my family and friends for sure!

For main course we ordered the surf and turf , with the crispy lobster.   We also ordered lobster fried rice.  What we got was the ginger garlic lobster and not the fried lobster.  The ginger lobster was also spoiled,  it had an underlying ammonia smell.  You could not smell it right away due to the ginger and garlic but once we got the left overs home that ammonia smell was definite .  The lobster fried rice has literally one piece of lobster.  With all of this,  I finally spoke up.  The manger was very kind and offered what she could to remedy the situation. She also offered to  change the fried rice which we accepted, only to see that the waitress charged us for two lobster fried rice.  I don‚Äôt mind paying for what I ate or ordered but , we did not get two fried rice.  This was my second visit and this visit was sub-par.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: After I convinced my date to take an hour drive on a rainy Sunday evening, We were seated 45 later than our reservation time. Already a bad start but we figured the food would make up for that Indiscretion,  We were sat at a very tiny table which we literally had to squeeze our arms in at the table to compensate for servers and patrons. We ordered 2 appetizers each that could  barely fit on the table, which prompted me to ask for a bigger table since I saw couples that came after us that didn‚Äôt have any reservation was seated at. But by the time the moving was concluded the mushroom soup we ordered was cold along with the three other appetizers. They sat us at the table which is equal to us sitting outside, every time the door opened we were ambushed with gushing freezing air. There are no proper waiting area and apparently reservations were being handled by someone who isn‚Äôt fit to be in that department. Every one that walked through the door somehow made their way next to our table and it was no longer us eating but us and 10 other ppl that was so close next to our table that I think they could see the fruit fly that wouldn‚Äôt leave us alone.  After speaking to the young lady at the front desk (there were 3 of them, the one who wore her tiny leather skirt and her bra straps popping out, that‚Äôs the one I‚Äôm talking about) (bad attitude as well) so I went to her and explained that we are not comfortable eating with very cold air every 2 mins however she seemed more annoyed than we were and said there‚Äôs nothing she could do and as she passed by countless times I don‚Äôt know what was more disturbing, her unpleasant face as she glared at us or the fact she didn‚Äôt want to make eye contact.  A $550.00 check for 2 ppl which would‚Äôve been more only if we were comfortable, nevertheless it wasn‚Äôt worth it!   I get that a business must utilize every square inch of their establishment but when it means having your patrons being cold and uncomfortable, is it really worth it???

The check of the vaccination cards were a joke as they didn‚Äôt ask for ID to go along with it and people just flashed quick pictures on their phones. The music was entirely too loud and there was a struggle to hear what the waiters/staff were saying to you. Due to the high volume the staff did not maintain social distance at all.  The tables were entirely too close together along the outer walls upstairs.  The food was‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs just say it left a lot to be desired and my entire group left unsatisfied and wishing we had made a different choice for our annual Christmas celebration dinner.  The best thing that I had on the menu was the apple crumb cheesecake and a glass of seltzer with lemon.  Overall, I would say save your money and a trip with expensive parking to Brooklyn Chophouse.  I should also add that it was extremely annoying that their door security saved multiple street parking spots with cones. NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I honestly heard only good things about this place. A lot of hype.  But unfortunately it wasn‚Äôt the case for us.  We had reservations at 8:30pm on a Friday.  We got there 10 min earlier ,and trust me when I say it was a good thing we got there earlier . We had to wait on line OUTSIDE (55 degrees weather) just to see the host.  After 20 min of waiting outside we FINALLY saw the host, she then advised us that there is NO open seat at the moment and we need to wait (DID I MENTIONED WE HAD A RESERVATION?! oh okay‚Ä¶)  We asked to wait for a table (for our reservation of 2 people) OUTSIDE AGAIN! and as advised by the host and manager ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt know how long this going to take but you can leave your number and we will text you)  So we did as advised and waited outside. For 25min! FINALLY - we walking to the table . And we were seated by the bar‚Ä¶ The place was packed!! The bar was crowded with people! So crowed that for the whole dinner it felt like they were eating with us at the table !  We waited 20 min for our drinks (we had the spicy watermelon margarita- it was sour and not strong at all!)  Thank God we ordered appetizers because we waited for 45 minutes for our entrees.. oh and that‚Äôs 45 minutes after we finished the appetizers .so as you can imagine we waited A LONG time for the food.  We had the veal chop and lamb chop ! - the veal chop was too well done although we asked for medium rare, and the lamb chop was burned as we asked for medium well.  I was scared to asked to get a new lamp chop since this took over an hour to get to our table but I had too asked for a new one since I couldn‚Äôt eat burned meat!  As we are waiting for the new lamb chop we asked for drinks, that took another 20 min to arrive to the table. And when they did we realized we received the wrong drinks. Took another 15 min to get someone to pay attention to us for us to request for the correct drinks.   OVERALL, the staff was nice and music was good. We didn‚Äôt enjoy anything else.

REVIEW: Intrigued by the unusual menu we booked a dinner. The restaurant is comfortable and has a nice ambiance. To start, the two mint and cucumber cocktails were very good. The appetizers were also tasty. We had the lamb dumplings and chicken lettuce wraps. Little did I know that at that point our experience had peaked. As for the entrees, first the good, my son's 16 oz filet mignon was exceptional. Cooked perfect and very tasty. However, my salt & pepper sea bass and my wife's crispy beef were extremely disappointing. When I order a $42 sea bass entree I not expecting it to be thinly cut, breaded and deep fried. It looked more (and tasted) like a haddock fish fry than a higher quality piece of fish. The taste was fairly bland and it needed the two dipping sauces...again this is sea bass not cod. The crispy beef came batter dipped and it had more batter than beef. TBH it looked and tasted like something from a mall food court. Both dishes were hugely disappointing and a terrible value at $42 and $35. I don't have any issue spending $ if the food is good. For example my son's 16 oz filet was $64 and I had zero issue with the price, as it was a solid cut and cooked to perfection.   Again, the restaurant was well reviewed and the combo steak house/Asian food vibe is/was intriguing. However going one for three (on the entrees) may get you into Cooperstown but it's not going to generate a whole lot of repeat business.

REVIEW: I love Brooklyn Chop House i eat here probably 4 times out if the month.

NAME: Waveyy
REVIEW: I love when places live up to the hype! Took bae here on Monday night for date night and we were not disappointed! The price tag is a little high but the food, drinks, and service was on point so it was definitely worth it! Natalia T was our waitress and she was great! She made some great suggestions and advised against certain things based on both her personal experience and other customer's. All her recommendations we ended up trying we're definitely on point! DRINKS: were really good and strong! I had the lychee froze to start and bae had a mix of the lychee and red velvet froze ($20 each). Bae wasn't sure which one she wanted so Natalia offered us samples of both to help us decide. Round 2 was the lychee ($16) & coconut/mango ($19) martinis (can you tell I love lychee lol). Natalia pointed out that the lychee martini was really creamy and thick and she didn't lie! It's the thickest lychee martini I've ever had which was a bit unusual but it was really tasty! I finished off with my other favorite, sidecar ($19) & bae had the casamigos blanca ($18) . Now while I live a sidecar, I don't always order it because not everyone knows how to make it right but it was definitely on point! I only wished the amount wasn't so small.  Food: came out freshly made and sizzling! Everything was seasoned to perfection as well, omg yum! I don't eat beef so no steak for us lol. We had the lobster Satay served with peanut sauce (2 pieces for $30) & crispy chicken wontons (5 pieces for $15) as our appetizers. Both were really good & I loved the fact that they didn't overcook the lobster! For our main course, I had the pork chops (2 pieces for $42 but they were nice & thick!) and bae had the spicy nine season shrimp ($42. I didn't count them lol but it was about 6 pieces). Sides are family sized/for sharing & we went with the garlic ginger mashed potatoes ($14), chicken fried rice ($14), and the broccoli & garlic ($17).  Everything was so tasty & the portion size was more than enough

NAME: Kajthekritic
REVIEW: Would never go here again. The food was bland and terrible . I would be doing a full review on my food page @kaj.the.kritic

Yes the soda was $5 which was water down by all the ice put in the glass cup! Fried rice which I could‚Äôve got from the chinese restaurant was $28 and honest it wasn‚Äôt that great.  My total bill was $154! The only thing I enjoyed was the red velvet cake which we all shared because 1 slice of cake is $18. I would also like to include that as we‚Äôre eating, the cleaners kept coming to our table picking up our plates and utensils. It got to the point when I had to ask them if they wanted us to leave. I never seen that before! I kept think they either wanted us to leave or had a shortage of plates! I wouldn‚Äôt go there again. I think they‚Äôre selling the experience of being there since a lot of celebrities ate there but honestly I could get way better soap dumplings and fried rice up the block from where I live and pay wayyyyyyyyyyy less!

NAME: LoriR
REVIEW: We picked BCH to celebrate a friend‚Äôs recent promotion and an upcoming birthday.  My friends got stuck in very bad traffic which caused them to be thirty minutes late‚ÄîI panicked because I know some restaurants will cancel your reservation‚Äînot BCH!  The hostess was very sweet and understanding, she checked me in early and suggested I go to the bar for a cocktail while waiting for the rest of my party to arrive.    I took her advice and to my surprise purchased an overpriced glass of house Chardonnay.  I go out a lot and $19 for a glass of average wine is a little over the top.    Once everyone arrived we were seated and our server, Boukary (such a sweet heart) helped us make some excellent cocktail and appetizer choices.  The Red Velvet froze is beyond delicious, as are the, spicy lamb gyro and philly cheesesteak dumplings. On scale of 1-10‚Äî10‚Äôs across the board!  For entrees we ordered,  salt + pepper sea bass, sweet +sour chicken, crispy shrimp fried rice and soft shell crab fried rice.  To our surprise all were very average‚Äîon a scale of 1-10, we gave it an overall score of 5.  It‚Äôs safe to say it‚Äôs the apps and cocktails for me!   We were pleasantly surprised when Boukary surprised us with two slices of red velvet cake complete with sparklers! When he introduced himself, he asked us what bought us to BCH‚Äî and he actually remembered.  That‚Äôs definitely a reflection of the owners.   The only thing we didn‚Äôt like‚Äîbut totally understand is that they gently nudge you to eat quickly and get out.     Other than that I will be going back for cocktails + apps.

Note that this is the complimentary side it with entrees.  My wife went with the spicy shrimp which she said was good.  We ordered the philly cheese steak dumplings to start but didn't taste anything cheese steak in nature.  They were still good so I'm just not sure if that's what they were supposed to taste like or if the waiter got the order wrong.  We also ordered the short rib bao buns which were pretty good.    It was a shame that the AC was not working in what was the hottest day of the 2021 summer but it wasn't terrible in the restaurant, just a tad warm.    I enjoyed the music and ambiance of the restaurant.  Definitely more trendy then more traditional steak houses.    Overall I'd like to go back and try some other dishes and would recommend this restaurant to people.  For the 2 of us, without alcohol, our bill can up to a little over $200 including the tip.

REVIEW: 1. This was mine and my boyfriend's first time eating here.  2. I called prior to confirm the dress code and was told " dress to impress, but no hoodies ". Knowing that, I told my boyfriend to leave his hoody in the car, which he did. But after being seated we spotted two other individuals with hoodies on, one being a customer and one being an employee. So that stood out to me, because it was a bit cold in the restaurant. 3. No one was available in the car parking lot, so we parked 2 blocks away, which wasn't a problem. But the convenience was having the lot close to the location, hopefully next time someone would be available. 4. Upon arriving, Security was AWESOME so very polite. Upon checking in, Staff was AMAZING. The ambiance was GREAT, Everything was Just so perfect. I did request a window seat, but was told they were all occupied, so we sat in the 2 seater high seat for more of an intimate date. 5. Customer service was BEYOND GREAT, the BUSSERS WERE SPECTACULAR. The food was SO VERY DELICIOUS AND TASTEFUL. The drinks were VERY WELL PREPARED AND MADE with LOVE.  6. The only thing that really stood out to me the most, was when the bill arrived and I was ready to formulate a tip. I said wait, and asked my boyfriend if he knew the name of our server. He said " no " & neither did I. Because the first thing we were asked was, would you guys like some water? Never did he introduce himself to us. So when I saw his name to be " Alex D " the receipt, I for sure knew he failed to tell us because my little sister's name is Alexandra and her nickname is " Alex " so if that name was said to me, I surely would have remembered. Hopefully, he remembers to introduce himself to his future guests. Im also in the food service | customer service business as well and customer is everything to me. You HAVE to love what you do with patience, common courtesy and hospitality. We did enjoy ourselves and this first time experience. We'll be back again. THANK YOU ALLL SO MUCHH !!

While on line we see the ‚Äúhost‚Äù taking people behind us off of the line and escorting them inside. It is obvious as to what is going on. I felt disrespected at the fact that on a cold night in the city that I had to wait over an hour outside on line for a reservation that I showed up to on time for while the girls with fake bodies and fake influence wake inside. No me and and my friend might not be those type of girls, we are hard working gainfully employed women. So when I asked what is taking so long I was told people weren‚Äôt getting up and that the Owners didn‚Äôt want to rush people to dine within the 90 minute time frame. In addition, the waiter told us due to it being so late we could not order any steaks, which was the reason why we came. Also they didn‚Äôt have any more soft shell crab or apple fried wontons. Talk about highly disappointed. The night was a total disaster.   Lastly we ordered some food to go. At 11pm they are looking at us like we were are stupid because we are still sitting there. NAME: Raymondc
REVIEW: I had been dying to come to this restaurant since April for my birthday because all the press, hype and good reviews I had seen. I was disappointed during my first experience this past weekend. I expected the mix of asian and American steak house to be one of the most tastiest things ever, after going to other steakhouses where the taste is very bland. I expected the chicken fried rice to be more flavorful also. Aside from that I am more so disappointed the experience for the amount of money I spent. The waiter rushed us to order and did not take time to even give us a run down of the menu. The waiter would just stop by every so often to see if we are ready in a very rushing tone. I had such high expectations and am very disappointed. He did make sure to let us know we had 90 minutes to order and eat though. I know covid-19 makes everything tough and you want to sit as many people as possible to make your money, but the experience needs to better in those 90 minutes you a-lot for people to sit. My recommendation is to improve the customer service experience so that it matches the amount of press and hype received. For $182 we could of went to Benihanas for half that price and gotten a warmer experience. Outside seating was very cluttered and cold which is why we waited to be seated inside, heaters were not very effective.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I surprized my girlfriend here for dinner to celebrate her 25th birthday and it was our first time at this restaurant. We had reservations for 8:30p. The service was superb. Gave me an "invite only" vibe like we were celebrities. Once we were seated, I was already impressed by the table set up. Plexiglass to separate tables, plastic wrapped plates & utensils, and a contactless menu QR code. I loved the atmosphere and ambiance. Very sexy, dimly lit, and music selection was dope. Jillian, our waitress, gave us the perfect rundown of what the restaurant had to offer since this was our first time here. It took us a while to decide what to order because everything looked so good. For our appetizers, we ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger Dumplings, Lobster "Spring Roll" Dumplings, and the Chicken Satay. Our favorite dumpling was the Bacon Cheeseburger and I loved the peanut sauce that came with the Chicken Satay. For our entrees, my girlfriend ordered the 16oz Filet Mignon (grilled medium well), I ordered the Steamed North Atlantic Bass, and we both agreed on the Soft Shell Crab Fried Rice to share between us. My steamed bass was good, but I enjoyed my girl's steak more. Our waitress checked in to make sure we were good and was enjoying our meals. She ended up informing us that we were getting a new waiter because it was time for her shift to end and she was leaving. Which didn't bother us. We just hoped our new waiter would also be good. And he was good. I wasn't able to catch his name, but he still made sure our needs were met. When it was time for dessert, I informed our waiter that we were celebrating a birthday and asked him for the Chocolate Swirl Cheesecake. My girlfriend loved everything about this restaurant and it made me very happy that I made the choice to come here. With that being said, I really loved this restaurant and I would definitely come back again and go down their menu to try different meals.

This time, upon arrival I told Tony we didn‚Äôt want any menus but wanted him to pick and bring his favorites/best sellers. I‚Äôm so glad we did that! After asking about our dietary restrictions and allergies, he delivered AND THEN SOME. If you go to BCH and Tony is there and you are a foodie (sorry picky eaters) I recommend doing the same. NAME: FoodieReese
REVIEW: The food here is amazing, but with the outdoor seating the overall ambience is a hit or miss!! If you're lucky enough to sit under a gazebo then it's nice, but if you get stuck at one of the tables along the side of the building it's just kind of tacky (which is what happened with my party). We also waited a ridiculously long time for appetizers - almost an hour. The appetizers came out right before the duck and the duck itself takes about an hour to prepare. We were not charged for the appetizers and the manager eventually came to apologize for the delay which was the right thing for them to do. It was just kinda sucky because the day we went it was a tad bit chilly and we were just sitting there for an hour before getting any food, so it took away from the whole experience. The food was great when we got it, but things also cooled off quickly because we were outdoors. Indoor seating is now available for this restaurant, but was unavailable during the time we came because a basketball player had apparently reserved the inside. Go figure! All in all, I would definitely return, but only to sit indoors.

REVIEW: I picked this location for my sons 11th birthday. During this time you are required to make reservation in which I did for 830pm. We arrived at 813pm and checked in with a hostess who informed up that we would be called for our table shorty. We didn‚Äôt get seated until 930pm. Upon be seated we took about 10 minutes to place our, so by 940pm our order was in. We sat awaiting  our food  but it‚Äôs now 1030pm (almost a hour later) and we have been served nothing but water. Asked to speak with a manger because this was poor customer service and he gave no assistance other than if you want to leave you can. That‚Äôs no way to handle an issue with a customer.

NAME: TashiR
REVIEW: This was my second time going to Brooklyn Chop, I went for my birthday in January and was so pleased that I went back with a friend for hers. We traveled from DC and it was well worth it, Jay was our waiter in January and again we were so please with the experiance that we stayed in touch. He actually came in on his off day to make sure our experience was just as great as the first time, this experience was actually better as we tried almost every appetizer they had to offer as well as numerous entree. The servings are already huge so you can imagine how full we were with food to take home. The dining outside is far more impressive then the outdoor dining locations I've seen as of late, theres a temperature check which definately made me feel comfortable given the state we are in, the dinnerware was wrapped in plastic and we were all socially distanced.  Jay brought over the owner who was very pleasent and accomodating, we definately enjoyed the full experience lol so much so that we went back the following day before getting on the road to come back to DC. NAME: SusanP
REVIEW: Made a reservation for Valentine‚Äôs Day and apparently they decided to turn that into a prix fixe menu. $175 for two people and they did not mention that when you made the reservations. We got there at 4 PM and it wasn‚Äôt even half full.  they offered to let us buy extra food from Menu if we wanted to get a steak but Not only steak. servers were nice but distracted.  The food ended up costing more prix fixe then it would have if we just order it off the menu. That place is jam packed with so many little tables that aren‚Äôt even big enough to hold the food.  Literally every inch of the table Realestate was covered up and plates were hanging off the edges. There‚Äôs no way the waiters can efficiently move around because there was no space to squeeze in between people and they were constantly having to bump into peoples chairs to get by. I‚Äôve literally never seen anything like it. upstairs had a speaker cranking out very loud music. The food was just OK. The salt and pepper lobster Supposedly 2 pounds was mostly shell they literally cut up the lobster with the shell on it and deep-fried it. Except there was only two pieces of tail in there which means they took out the good parts and deep-fried everything else. No seasoning. It was so terrible. What a waste of $400 for TWO people. I will never be back.  Im so disappointed-based on the reviews I thought It was going to be fantastic.  We ordered a ribeye for an extra $70 because that‚Äôs what we wanted originally.  It was cooked perfectly but there was literally zero seasoning on it and they don‚Äôt even have salt and pepper on tables. plain meat flavor. Yuck. We started with the Satay, and lamb dumplings. We also got two cocktails ; the ‚Äúblackberry smash‚Äù, and the other one was called ‚ÄúThis Side of the Bridge‚Äù.  Drinks were absolutely amazing but server Did not feature or highlight any of them. Not only did he not go into depth about any of the menu items, but he also hardly came over for quality checks/table manicuring. HUGE No-No when you have guests that are spending big & traveling FAR. Server was very judgmental & negligent. Maybe too tired from fashion week?   I am writing this review not because I didn‚Äôt enjoy the food, drinks, or ambiance, but because I HATED everything about our service. To top that off it was very clear who the GM/Owner was. He was dressed very nicely and seemed to be checking in on tables however I noticed he ONLY interacted with 1 table the entire time we sat! I probably starred this guy down atleast 5 times desperately trying to give him the cue to stop by our table and ask how it was going. Instead he would glance back without ever coming over, or just outright not even look back. I felt very annoyed knowing I traveled to specifically eat at HIS restaurant and not even one time were we approached by the GM/Owner. I really expected more and I would have loved to leave 22% as the food  but that service (not so much).

NAME: BkCassie
REVIEW: I THOROUGHLY ENJOYED MY DINNER HERE! But make sure that you set your GPS to lower Manhattan because there is nothing going on at 150 Nassau Street in Brooklyn. After 7 PM would be the ideal time to go because you should be able to easily snag a parking spot in front of the restaurant.  The dining experience was 5-star because everything was full of flavor. I would caution that the appetizers are not enough for sharing but definitely order one of their unique Asian fusion options per person. The shining star was our 32 oz Prime steak which was cooked to the perfect temperature, wonderfully seasoned and accompanied by a generous amount of ‚Äúau jus" sauce. We also shared an order of crab fried rice which was delicious.   The awesome food was complimented by the stellar service provided by Jay. Being a fellow Capricorn, he made sure to pay us enough attention, kept the birthday boy's glass full at all time and even brought up a slice of red velvet cake at the right time. He set the bar so high that I wouldn't chance sitting in anyone else's section upon my next visit.  Looking for a great steak but needing more variety than your usual boring steakhouse sides then this is exactly where you need to dine!

Waiter informed that Chef and staff has walked out. Here‚Äôs the icing on the cake, waiter noted that Manager would be over to discuss  and assumingely apologize. We waited an add‚Äôl 15 mins to be told by waiter that the Manager is busy and won‚Äôt be coming and basically we should just leave and they will take care of the cocktails we ordered. This is unacceptable! Never thought this would be how we end the night at 1:30am looking for food that we thought we made a reservation for.  Brooklyn Chop House should Chop it up! This type of service and experience will not sustain a business!

To be honest, we thought it was just gross. One of the people with us ordered the ribeye and that was just okay as it was a bit overcooked as well and the flavor wasn't too great. NAME: Phoenix
REVIEW: Came here for my mom's 55th birthday.  What I love about places like this is the ability to order a lot of food for the table and be able to eat communally.  We ordered the  Alaskan king crab legs, sweet and sour chicken,  braised short ribs, broccoli, and shrimp fried rice.  Everything was great, but the short ribs really took the cake.  I'm used to short ribs slathered in a sauce, usually barbecue.  I didn't miss that here at ALL.  I can tell that the flavor was intentionally built as every bite was amazing. Broccoli may seem basic, but it was anything but that at BCH; perfectly steamed, and seemed to be seasoned from within.  My mom and dad are some of the pickiest eaters-- it's often hard to get them to step out of their comfort zone, and they don't hesitate to let me know when they don't like something! BCH got rave reviews from them both, and I'm sure we all will be back. A special shout out to management for being accommodating of my mom's need to use accessibility options as she is in a scooter; everything was done with a smile and I'm so grateful for that.

Bottle of sweet white wine very tasty being I don‚Äôt drink but it was so good I had 3 glasses. Surf & turf Lobster tails & filet mignon melted in your mouth like butter!! Beef & broccoli, crispy chicken rice for two every thing was delicious and the chocolate cake is do die for ...super moist cake ..all I need was a glass of milk ...very expensive place but it was worth every penny ...after all it was my 50th birthday..you only live once treat your self !!

NAME: NikiaE
REVIEW: On a scale of 1 to 10, I'd give Brooklyn Chop House an 8. The food was delicious we ordered the 24 oz. bone in rib eye, pan fried chicken dumplings, lobster fried rice, and duck. The rib eye was delicious and the sauce that was Asian steak sauce and very tasty. The duck is prepared and carved table side which is a wonderful plus and very rich tasty along with the pancakes, wonton taco's and hoisan sauce. The pan fried dumplings were awesome! My only disappointment was the lobster fried rice in which I recommend not to order as it barely had any lobster in it and the pieces that were in it were microscopic so this was very disappointing.  The tables are pretty close to one another as well so if you're not comfortable almost eating in an almost communal setting it might not be the place for you.  The wait staff is very professional and knowledgeable about the selections and they don't hover over you and they check on you appropriately.  I would definitely go back but never ordering the $27 lobster fried rice that's missing lobster!

NAME: AyannaD
REVIEW: Went to this restaurant on Saturday, February 16th for my bestfriends Birthday it was recommended to me by another friend who enjoyed her time at the there. I made a reservation for 9:30pm didn't get seated until around 10:30. The restaurant was packed and the hosts seemed overwhelmed because their were so many people waiting to be seated. When the hostess finally seated us we were crammed into an area that barely fit all 3 of us. The tables were super close to one another and she didn't even pull the table out so that my friend could squeeze in to her seat. Once seated we had a server that appeared to be new because she kept forgetting drinks and seemed flustered. I had to ask her what were the most popular dishes since it had been our first time there. So instead of telling me the most popular dishes she proceeded to tell me about each different steak. Drinks took forever to come out appetizers came out at a decent time they were delicious. We received our entrees about 25mins after that, I expected to have a better experience with this restaurant. I know some restaurants have good and bad days so I will possibly give this place another chance.

REVIEW: Worst experience- food was not as described - seafood dumpling was suppose to be a variety of seafood but it all tasted like shrimp; and beef noodles were greasy and the beef didn‚Äôt taste like real beef; service was even worst - no clear waiter; waited for 20min to get a glass of wine and when the waiter showed up he was rude and exasperated. I left feeling they had better things to do; well so did I. To top it off managment tried to fix things via a phone message that stated the waiter knew we were upset and just waited to give us time to calm down. My friend and I are two women; neither of us raised our voices; we stated the facts in a calm fashion. Just the sheer fact they thought we had to calm down makes me think this place is run by sexist men; please my money is as good as any guy. Oh yeah forgot about the rather large chunk of bone I found in my meal of which the waiter didn‚Äôt acknowledge until I stated (in a calm voice) that an apology is due rather then him walking away ignoring the issue. NAME: Tash
REVIEW: I must say Brooklyn Chophouse has a wonderful cuisine and my tastebuds were thoroughly impressed..when I finally was attended to. I was so disappointed in the quality of service is such an eclectic looking restaurant. I literally waited 25 minutes just to finally be offered water for the table and then our table was ignored again for another 10 minutes. To the point where I physically had to leave the table and get a drink at the bar and watched the supposed server looking bored standing by the bar and she asked me how im doing as I caught her eye and I was just in shock with her non chalant attitude. When she finally came back to our table it was just to tell us she's not serving us anymore and threw someone named Daniel on us as if she couldn't be bothered. Thank god she did that because he was a breath of fresh air and he made up for what she was lacking. Overall, it's hard to recommend anyone as I am not sure if the service has improved, im hoping that was an isolated incident but it surely didn't leave the best impression on me or my best friend that dined with me.

NAME: Gigi
REVIEW: Awesome night! Only thing we ended up getting a ticket...

NAME: ShariJ
REVIEW: We decided to try Brooklyn chop house for NYC Restaurant Week 2019. The food and drinks were exceptional however they did run out of certain items for desert. Our waiter was pleasant and knowledgeable about the food. Unfortunately, our main course took forever to be served. Our waiter apologized for the delay and gave us a free round of drinks which was greatly appreciated.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: On a Friday night make a reservation and prepare to wait. Noisiest wheel gets the oil here. There was a guy with no reservation but he called 10 mins before he came and was told to come but now he had to wait. One host was quite concerned with finding him a table rather than addressing  those holding a reservation, arrived on time, and was still waiting. I had an 8:30 Res arrived at 8:20 and didn't  get seated until 8:50. Not sure the point of reservations here. I have been here twice now. During the week its busy, but so far Friday is very busy. Wait service has been 50/50 btwn the two visits, one excellent  the other awful and unattentive, both were friendly. The food is always good. I think it is over priced. The portions are normal. The quality of food is amazing, making the price reasonable. The steaks look amazing look forward to trying them next time. Dumplings were great. Green spinach shrimp dumplings  have whole shrimp not minced, yay! Cheesesteak dumplings  were tasty. Beef and broccoli, Crispy beef, was good. Drinks were okay, 1st drink was watered down, second drink better. The Friday energy is completely  turned up.  Definitely  will go again on a Friday but need to figure out the waiting for a Res thing.

NAME: K423
REVIEW: Nice calm spot to go on a date

NAME: JannyB
REVIEW: I was looking forward to our visit after hearing people talk about it, but was disappointed by our visit.  I came for Restaurant Week since it was an opportune time to check it out and it was clear that they were trying to promote it since I had to ask if the had the menu for it.  I dined elsewhere earlier in the week and the restaurant included the menu with the regular menu.  We ordered from that menu and the regular menu and while the pastrami dumplings were great, the strip steak lacked flavor.  The Filet Mignon Sandwich was tasty, but on the small size for a hungry guy.  Sidenote: the waitress entered the sandwich order in wrong so we had to wait for it since they brought out a steak.  They also brought out white rice instead of fried rice.  I had a spicy mango margarita, which simply tasted like spicy mango juice with no tequila.  The best part of the restaurant is the space.  It's super sexy and the music was good, but it's NYC and you can find that anywhere.  Definitely won't be going back.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Great food and service

NAME: LawannieL
REVIEW: The New Hot Spot in NYC... Food was amazing however, The Salt & Pepper Lobster was a little to breaded.. I will definitely be Back!!

As soon as he came in, we were seated immediately. We had a waiter and and waitress tend to us. They were both so friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. The drinks were tasty, the food was delicious, and the overall ambiance was amazing! Will definitely be coming again!

NAME: Dalton
REVIEW: Great food but service has room for improvement. Staff seems new.

NAME: Kiki
REVIEW: The food was surprisingly really great! The ambiance was great too.

Went for brunch on Sunday, there were more servers then tables in the room but they could not handle it.  We waited 10 minutes to even order drinks, then to order brunch.  Our food came before our drinks....every time our food came out it went to the wrong table. Staff was so unprofessional, food runners seemed high.  After we finished eating and were waiting another 15 minutes for our 2nd round of drinks, a staff member came by and asked if "we were gucci."   Just a really awkward and disappointing experience.

NAME: RolekeG
REVIEW: All in all food was good the vibe was nice the frink was a little pricey it was a lityle dim but nice

REVIEW: We really enjoyed our first visit here, however, our server was very inattentive.  The food was wonderful, as was the atmosphere.
