NAME: GN81
REVIEW: Excellent food, and beautiful ambiance. We especially enjoyed the crispy steak. Would highly recommend.

NAME: Cscruggs
REVIEW: I enjoyed my birthday here. The N.y. Strip steak was cooked just right. The chicken chinese fried rice for two was tasty and the metal canister that it was contained in was cute. Loved my lychee martini although it was a little too sweet . Our server Patenda was great . The only complaint I have is that in my reservation I said it was my birthday and that I wanted a candle in a dessert.

NAME: Lunabee
REVIEW: Great lunch!  We chose the prix fixe.  Onion soup dumplings and veggie rolls to start.  Dumplings were delicious.  Perfect starter for a cold day.  Next beef with broccoli and black bean chicken. Chicken was perfectly spiced. Not too sweet. Small bite sized tender chunks.  Beef also well seasoned and broccoli still crunchy.  Dessert fried apple filled dumplings with vanilla ice cream. To die.  Service was attentive although kitchen was somewhat slow. We were not in a hurry so it was all good.  Will certainly go again.

NAME: JoiW
REVIEW: Love this place, dumplings are AMAZING. Everytime I eat there the owner comes to the table, Hes a wonderful man!  Lobster Fried Rice is my Fave,  Philly Cheese Dumplings and Broccoli!

NAME: XavierC
REVIEW: The food and ambiance was amazing. The wait was very long but although we had a reservation. Very hip trendy crowd, great music selection.

NAME: popenyc
REVIEW: Bartender, Hostess, Server (Christine), and bus staff extremely helpful and pleasant. Outstanding staff.  Managers were amazing also.

NAME: FoodieNYC
REVIEW: Excellent Service and Great Food!

NAME: NeeceD77
REVIEW: Great food and great service as usual! A great vibe as well.

NAME: MeredithB
REVIEW: Food was outstanding and service impeccable! The menu options are absolutely unique and delicious!

NAME: SUeda
REVIEW: Please note, this is my first review at OpenTable and regularly dine throughout the United States and abroad for both business and leisure.  I am leaving this review since I was thoroughly disappointing by the waitress and wanted to inform any potential guests who plan on hosting a business dinner of the lack of professionalism and training at the venue.  The overall food and experience was good however the waitress was terrible.  The waitress didn't provide an opportunity to taste the wine despite ordering both expensive reds and whites and just began pouring for the table.  Once the table was done ordering, I had asked about sides in order to complete the order and whether we had enough food and provided guidance that ended up with the table with 8 orders of rice (2 per serving) for a table of 9.  The waitress approached the guests and not the host when there were timing issues in the kitchen. Lastly, she was serving peking duck and began using her unwashed hands and touched the pancakes.  The food, the concept and the experience are great but the waitress clearly needs training.  I realize this wasn't a 3-star Michelin restaurant but this was a steakhouse in the Financial District in New York City and she was barely serviceable in a TGI Fridays at a airport.

NAME: Mizcity
REVIEW: Venue is nicely decorated. In an area lacking steakhouses, it would benefit from sticking to that niche with a mid level price point instead of trying to incorporate Asian fusion. The name chophouse is a bit misleading. It‚Äôs hard to do Asian fusion well when you have Chinatown not far away. Service has some kinks to work out. Did not drink but the bar looks like a cute area to grab one.

NAME: TJohn
REVIEW: I loved the relaxed feel of the restaurant.  It was very comfortable dining. I would definitely return to try more dishes. All of dishes we tried were good - spring rolls, salad and french onion soup dumplings.  Service was a little slow and the waitress was not that welcoming but the food was good and affordable.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: En general bueno. La comida buena, pero un poco caro para la oferta gastron√≥mica realmente.

NAME: Gemmy
REVIEW: Quick service great food, wonderful ambience.

NAME: shekeraA
REVIEW: Great service and good food.

NAME: MJSENAT
REVIEW: My shrimp had so much breading by the time I got to the shrimp, they weren't really prawns, just extra large shrimp. Drinks were good. Our server, Sue,  was good too.

NAME: Young
REVIEW: The service was very slow and staff were disorganized. Food was alright. The dumplings are overrated. The concept of a steak house with Asian influence is poorly executed in terms of menu and incorporation of cuisine. Given the price, it is not particularly a good value.   I don't think I will visit again.

NAME: TamaraB
REVIEW: The waiting for the food and waitress to take our order was not good and should have been  better!

NAME: Toi727
REVIEW: The food was sooo good. The ambiance was just right. I really enjoyed it

NAME: Citigal
REVIEW: Should try at least once.  Beautiful space but uncomfortable seating, nowhere to put anything.  I understand need to maximize space given Manhattan real estate prices, but at least have a coat check option in winter.  The man at the station by the door was on the phone when we walked in and didn't bother to acknowledge us.  He was busy reading things off the menu to whoever was on the phone.  Another woman showed up after a minute and seated us.  Since one of the selling points is dim sum and small plate options for sharing, tables are not especially geared for that.  Two of us ordered 4 items and it barely fit on the table as it all came out at once.  We cleared a plate to make more room.  The bacon cheeseburger dumplings were on the salty side but juicy.  The pac man dumplings were cute in presentation but uninspiring in flavor, basically a dressed up "har gow" (shrimp dumpling).  The peking duck tacos were tasty.  The rice was not "crispy" in the soft shell crab crispy rice but it was good.  The apple wontons for dessert were delicious.  Drinks are creative but no happy hour prices at the tables.  Also, if you're seated near the larger tables, servers bring one of those folding trays when their food is brought out so you feel like you're hovering over somewhere else's food.  Overall, the experience was enjoyable.  Not sure it's a "must repeat" but would certainly go back if option arises.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Staff very friendly

NAME: Tawlshaun
REVIEW: It was a great way to bring in the new year and celebrate our Anniversary!!!

NAME: Realtor
REVIEW: The service was terrible. They gave us blank menues to start with. The waitress was very confused. Took our order asked weird questions. Brought everything out but in the wrong order. Food was good but becuace of the service I would not go back. The Bus staff was EXCELLENT.

NAME: DOEworkers
REVIEW: We had an excellent time, celebrating my parents 70th birthday (Both).

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was descent but I was a bit annoyed that we had to wait 30 mins for a table even though we had reservations. Our server was horrible, she only came by the table once to check in. I constantly had to look around to find some one to get us drinks . It was even a process just to get the proper utensils to eat our food

NAME: Steaklover
REVIEW: Excellent service and superior food.  Clearly this management team knows their stuff. Fine addition to the neighborhood.

NAME: Kim825
REVIEW: Great place, 3rd time coming here. Love the food, love the ambiance, love the staff.

NAME: Abby
REVIEW: Our waitress was very nice. She was a young, short haircut, blondish hair, caucasian female. I thought I heard someone call her Sam but I'm not sure. Her service was great.  She was very accommodating and friendly.  The food was also very good. I had the NY strip and my hubby had the ribeye and mayo shrimp appetizer. I also had the pac man wonton. Food was good. Nice staff. Would go again.

NAME: SunniC
REVIEW: Food was great. Service needs some work. Overall pretty good.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Came here for our 24th wedding anniversary. Hosts were great except a big part of the restaurant was semi empty and they sat a large group literally right next to us. We even went early so it would be a little romantic. Service was just ok. The bus staff was on point and our water glasses never went empty, but our waitress never told us her name and was very inattentive. The wait staff was standing at the end of the dining area talking to each other. That and having the big group sat right next to us with plenty of space available is the only thing that brings the rating down. The food and drinks were unbelievable! I would eat here again just for the food. We had bacon cheeseburger dumplings, crispy vegetable rice for two, Kung Pao chicken and beef and broccoli. I can't even tell you what kind of beef it was because it melted in your mouth and I've never tasted anything like it before. Absolutely amazing! They even brought out a dessert for our anniversary. I would highly recommend! We will be back if they can get their service to match the food experience.

NAME: JonathanD
REVIEW: All the Dumplings are amazing, the martini's and specialty drinks are tasty

NAME: ARDBARTA
REVIEW: Food.......delicious.....mood, character, and atmosphere were delightful! Service was very gracious, kind, friendly and attentive.  Our dining experience was just as lovely as was the meal!!

NAME: EnglishmaninNY
REVIEW: Good enough place. Food is good but the steak - which is supposed to be their signature dish - was too fatty and disappointing. Service was also below expectations - both during meal (wait was way too long) and at reception

NAME: LaRayG
REVIEW: My daughters birthday

NAME: SonyaKay
REVIEW: Good food.  Friendly service, but slightly slow.  The restaurant seems pretentious.  I like to eat good food and enjoy being out...cost is not an issue if I am enjoying the space.

NAME: mary20
REVIEW: We love BCH!! Spare ribs,excellent top quality! As all NYC restaurants the tables are tight but the staff makes it E-Z to navigate! The Staff is very professional and efficient. Our waiter Daniel took very good care of us! The bar area has very nice ambiance as well as a great Happy Hour! Dumplings are excellent! Crispy rice Yummy! Beef with noodles tasty and tender! Some things have a batter and are fried, which surprised us. The owner checked in with us and asked if we had any questions that‚Äôs always nice! BCH is a great addition to the neighborhood!

NAME: JackG
REVIEW: Delicious steaks along with asian inspired dim sum dishes.

NAME: DarienneK
REVIEW: We‚Äôre local and started coming here vs Mr Chow - the vibe and scene has changed since it opened. We have dined here a few times and brought friends from out of town. An unfortunate scene occurred when my husband entered the men‚Äôs room this evening to a drug conversation. It definitely brought to consciousness that this wasn‚Äôt the place we thought it was going to be. It has degraded each visit and several events we thought might be appropriate to bring here have made us think differently. We will not be returning. Not our scene. We enjoy good food and an enjoyable environment - this establishment not longer embodies this for us.

NAME: HenryP
REVIEW: Overall great experience and ambiance

NAME: Robert
REVIEW: Service was terrible, ruined the experience- poorly managed.  Pricey considering the waitstaff is unprofessional and management more concerned about their phone screens than customers‚Äô experience.

NAME: KynaP
REVIEW: Had the best time!  Service was excellant and the food was fabulous, especially that lobster satay! Delish

NAME: innar
REVIEW: Great food great service fun on Beyonce. Cute bar scene really interesting dishes

NAME: TerrellC
REVIEW: I love supporting BLACK OWE RESTAURANT. He did a fantastic job coming from the person I knew to developing himself into something great. I‚Äôm very proud of him. That soul food twist with Asian incorporated was not a good choice for my group. We automatically thought of good soul food and the Asian twisted made it something too unknown. I‚Äôm a foodie so I like to go to the best when I choose a particular type of food. This combo didn‚Äôt mixes well for us especially for the price. Everything was absolutely amazing other than the most important reason why I came. The FOOD

NAME: Chakag
REVIEW: Our table was in extremely busy location in the middle of a walkway... we asked for our seat to be changed they told us that table was booked for a big party, then 15 minutes later a party of 2 (same size as our party) was seated there. The food was good. The head waiter was dismissive. And it took long to be greeted initially and pretty much the flow was slow.  The drinks were ok. Oh and no parking just a parking lot only $25 tho. Would I come back? Probably not.

NAME: ARDBARTA
REVIEW: The food was simply divine.  Especially the rum cake!

NAME: Eteam
REVIEW: Appetizers were okay but  no better than a corner Chinese take out.  Entrees were lousy, especially the Drunkin Bronzino.  Pieces of fish floating in a sweet, luke warm gelatin.  Where did they get this chef? My co worker could not eat the Bass sandwich.  She thought it was too oily.  Very overpriced for this type of food.  Even the presentation was weak for a place like this.  Like a said, you can do much better at a local  take out joint for a fraction of the price.

NAME: Sheryl
REVIEW: Welcoming interior, and creative combination of Asian & steakhouse themes. Onion Soup Dumplings were a fun twist, and the prixe fix lunch deal is a great value.  The server was very nice, but was inaccurate describing a couple of dishes -- will chalk that up to the restaurant being new.

NAME: Jmel21
REVIEW: This Chop House is not what you expect. Staff was less than welcoming despite it not being terribly busy when we arrived. We were made to wait for our reservation despite obviously open tables.  Tables are right on top of each other and noise is high.  Took the waiter quite a while to ask for drinks and to bring menus.  The food was good, not quite worth the price but tasty with surprising combinations available.  The shrimp fried rice, the short rib buns and the ginger beef noodles were all good.  The steaks were nicely seasoned and properly cooked. Having thought we were going to a steak house we got a different experience.  If they can improve service it could be a decent alternative to the typical steak house.

NAME: mswells1121
REVIEW: The food was great. I drove in from LI and it was worth the distance.  The food was also worth every penny.  The Lychee Martini was also decadent, a must have.

NAME: AngelaR
REVIEW: Went to Brooklyn chop house first time. Set reservations Prior to, yet we had to wait 30 mins.  (Its NYC every restaurant has a wait time)However the manager made it worth our while. They were super attentive to us, kept checking on us and They gave us free drinks along with free desert. Once we ordered the food it  came out right away. Delicious!!Will definitely go back!!

NAME: KinaD
REVIEW: Food was amazing! Drinks were great..( for the price they better had been lol) ambiance nice! Just a great vibe!

NAME: kristinat
REVIEW: We had the most wonderful meal and drinks The duck was unbelievable.  Nice walk before across the Brooklyn Bridge Can‚Äôt wait to return!

NAME: FiveStar
REVIEW: The Ribeye was good, but overpriced. The Blackberry Smash Cocktail was great!

NAME: checkplease
REVIEW: A little slow on the delivery of meals

NAME: DavidG
REVIEW: Great place with good food, drinks and upbeat atmosphere.

NAME: RhondaS
REVIEW: Great place ! We enjoyed the restaurant especially the service and the $24.95 lunch special !

NAME: Diningindmv
REVIEW: In the words of Kurtz from Joseph Conrad‚Äôs ‚ÄúHeart of Darkness‚Äù...the horror...the horror.  Without a doubt the worst restaurant experience we have ‚Äúdined‚Äù at in many years.  The staff were very gracious, but were eclipsed by what we assume was the manager/owner who was bragging about opening ‚ÄúPhilippe‚Äù. Never heard of it, but we can only hope the food was better than the school cafeteria fare served to us.  We ordered the chicken satay which had a very odd color and taste and was nowhere near the menu description. I would recommend reading the reviews on Yelp and OpenTable before booking. What a disappointment!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The food is great but everything else is so bad you forget about the great food.  I was so excited when it open in my neighborhood but wont be heading back anytime soon.   My reservation was for 7:15 and was finally seated at 7:50 and with no apologies.  After complaining I got 1 drink complimentary.   The server messed up our order and and did not place our entree order.  When we inquired about it we she said we never ordered it.  After a long back and forth she finally place the order.  This place is only focused on large groups which are loud and acting like it is a private party space which ruins the experience for everyone else.  The tables for 2 are so badly placed you are bumped into all night by the staff.  The owner is clearly not trying to make this a neighborhood place.  My compliments to the chef but everyone else needs to be trained and taught hospitality!!!

NAME: MJSENAT
REVIEW: Our waiter was just not attentive, and it wasn't even crowded .  Kept forgetting condiments, extra utensils.  food was fair this time. very shock

NAME: BashiraH
REVIEW: I love this restaurant. I've been there twice and plan on going back plenty of more times. Everything that I ate was so good and I got something different each time so I could see how it taste and it was great. I told all of my friends about it and they also love it too.

NAME: carolh
REVIEW: The space is really nice but tables are very tight, and service was extremely slow (although they re trying and they re over staffed ). Took 45 minutes wait between appetizer and main dish. Menu is eclectic with lots of choices. Some of the dishes are good, but overall very greasy. Didn‚Äôt particularly enjoy the experience.

NAME: DLVATL
REVIEW: Menu was interesting...kind of hard to make sense of how much food we needed to order.  I ordered dumplings and a small plate...both of which came BEFORE my husbands meal.  So I ate slow so that we were eating at the same time and then all my food was cold when he finally got his steak (Which we had to ask and remind them to bring it to the table).  People tried to clear my food 3 times while we were waiting for his food to be brought.  We watched food be brought to the wrong tables 3 times while we were there and we also saw people start their meal and then asked to be moved because they didn't like where they were sitting.  Seating is awkward, the staff is constantly bumping into each other....all very strange  We wanted to like it but I doubt we will go back.

NAME: LisaM
REVIEW: The dumplings and dim sum were outstanding!  the main courses (hamburger, crispy beef) were ok.  Would come back for drinks and dim sum but not dinner.  Also dining room was very tight - too many tables.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Pre Dinner drinks were excellent; I got to order Duck and Dumplings as my sides !!! ... Go, you will not be disappointed.  Finally, the owner personally came over - said hello and welcomed us - excellent host...

NAME: ug1976
REVIEW: Pastrami dumplings, French onion soup dumplings, short ribs and crab fried rice are to die for. The rest is really good, solid execution not mind blowing though. Friendly environment with very good service. Wine list OK not great.

NAME: RufusD
REVIEW: This place is great for entertaining someone you'd like to impress. The food can get a bit pricey for the portion though. A serviced of rice for two is really only enough for one person.

NAME: Ravi
REVIEW: The Best restaurants in New York City!! Food is AMAZING!! Stratis go above and beyond to check-in with everyone to ensure they are enjoying the food and if there is anything he or his staff can do they will!!!

NAME: ArleneL
REVIEW: One of the best dining experiences ever. The owner spoke with us and the food was delicious.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Amazing people and food!

NAME: Disappointment
REVIEW: The dumplings were fantastic, but the burger was incredibly greasy and did not taste particularly great. The service was awful - at one point we gave up trying to flag our waiter down and started going to the register to pay because we‚Äôd been waiting 20+ minutes.  I will not come back due to the service and would not recommend the burger, but the dumplings were absolutely awesome.

NAME: JessArt
REVIEW: Upon arrival (on time at 7:30pm), we were checked in by a young lady at the front desk and was told we would be seated soon.  While standing by the desk, the hostess walked up and proceeded to take a customer who walked in after us, late for a 6:45pm reservation.    The same hostess returned again, never acknowledged my husband and I standing at the desk waiting to be seated.  Another couple walked in for a 7:30 reservation after us.  The hostess then recognized the gentleman and proceeded to greet him with a hug.  She then turned to the young lady at the desk and said, ‚ÄúLet me take them first‚Äù.  She never greeted us or even gave us eye contact.  At that point, we were waiting for fifteen minutes to be seated.  I requested to speak to a manager.  I was then approached by a gentleman who asked if we wanted to be seated before seeing a manager in which I declined.  Surprisingly, the same hostess who initially ignored us approached me and asked if she could help me with anything, I declined again asking to speak to a manager for the second time.  Finally, the manager Philippe appeared and immediately seated us after I told him what transpired when we checked in.  Having experience in the restaurant/hotel industry, I must say that this was not a good first impression on this new establishment at all.  Thankfully, our server Daniel was excellent and made us feel comfortable.  I want to say he saved the day after a horrible start at the front of the house.  During our dining experience, I was met with not so nice looks from both the hostess and gentleman who attempted to resolve my issue before having to call a manager.     Upon our departure, the hostess gave us a dirty look then walk away from the desk without a farewell or any parting words.  The young lady who checked us in told us to have a wonderful evening.    Staff is a huge reflection on any establishment and if they are not professional or trained properly, it can definitely result in negative reviews.

NAME: KarenP
REVIEW: Great food. I've been here twice. Absolutely love everything about this restaurant.

NAME: ElaineB
REVIEW: Nice place for a casual brunch

NAME: MayaT
REVIEW: We waited an hour even though we had a reservation.The seating process seemed disorderly with patrons who arrived after us seated before we were because they were more vocal about their long wait. The food was mediocre at best. The steak for two entree was burnt and very salty which is unusual for a Dry Aged Steak. Definitely not the service or food quality expected for a restaurant at that price point.

NAME: MoKa
REVIEW: Went to Chophouse for the first time Friday night. Took a while to get seated even with a reservation but there was an open spot at the bar so we didn‚Äôt mind. Great lychee martinis. Great food. Great dessert. Would definitely recommend.

NAME: CarmenS
REVIEW: Great vibe and outstanding food.  Variety is excellent and price point is very reasonable.  Will add this place to my favorites.

NAME: CalvinT
REVIEW: Service was incredibly slow, orders were messed up, and the Asian fusion was just not good.

NAME: Cags
REVIEW: Nice calm 31st birthday dinner.. We had a reservation for 9:30 but pushed it back to 10 with no issues.. We were seated as soon as we arrived. Being that it was an hour before closing it was pretty quiet which I loved! Food was great service was good.. But the manager was so rude to the waitstaff.. I couldn‚Äôt help but notice how condescending and disrespectful he was towards them! Other than that my bf and I enjoyed our meal!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Terrible service. Food is not worth the price at all

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Some of the worst service I‚Äôve ever experienced

NAME: Susan
REVIEW: Unique menu - the party I was with was not very adventurous.  Would be fun with a group willing to split multiple entrees.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Awesome. Cool service

NAME: TiffanyJ18
REVIEW: Wonderful dining experience! The staff was so accommodating and the food was delicious!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Probably one of the best restaurants we have ever ate at!

NAME: EmanueleM
REVIEW: Amazing food service and ambiance. Will be back!

NAME: LauraD
REVIEW: We had a reservation for 8pm, arrived at 7:45am and finally left at 9:30pm when our table was still not ready.  No one came to speak to us, apologize to us or offer drinks. Everytime we went to the host stand, we were told the table would be ready in 3 minutes.  Finally when we refused to buy the drinks we had, they paid our bar tab, but only after much pleading.  Luckily we found a table at a restaurant nearby at 9:45pm.  This was a celebration for two birthdays and the evening was ruined.

NAME: Luv2eat
REVIEW: We had a wonderful dinner - my only complaint was I asked for my filet mignon black & blue and it was not so I had to sit and wait for another while everyone else ate.  They also never brought mushrooms but they were on the bill so had to change that.  I know the restaurant is new so I will overlook.  See private comment below.

NAME: DianaC
REVIEW: We had a reservation and it took 1 hour to get seated. We got a free drink but still. It came when we got seated an hour later. Food was good

NAME: KatieA
REVIEW: This was hands down one of the worst dining experiences I have had in a long time.

NAME: Ako12
REVIEW: Food was very underwhelming and our waiter‚Äôs recommendations were disappointing. Will not be returning.

NAME: DanielC
REVIEW: Great Service from attentive staff, Great food and desserts. I will definitely be attending in the near future.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The restaurant had more tables than it should because there was no room for wait staff to walk by. We were hit on all four sides of our table constantly throughout the meal. If staff was not walking by they were basically leaning against our table having conversations with other staff. When it was time to leave, we had to push our way out because the staff was standing over our table and not moving. Would not recommend.

NAME: NaddsB
REVIEW: Food, service and ambiance were top notch! I will definitely return.

NAME: MJSENAT
REVIEW: Nico our waiter was awesome. The suggestions were on point.  The food was great.  Drink we‚Äôre awesome.  We loved Caleb such a great host. Thank you Robert!!!! Such a great restaurant. Great staff and Ofcourse great food. Btw. Love the location 17 minutes from bed stuy

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I had an amazing experience at the chop house. The food was out of this world and the service was impeccable. I‚Äôm so glad I stopped by to check this place out. I will be returning.

NAME: TylerC
REVIEW: Worst service I have ever experienced at a NYC restaurant.

NAME: YaronV
REVIEW: Booking a table is meaningless  Waited 90 minutes to a reservation of 930pm

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Made the reservation and waited an hour and half with no sign of being seated. 15 min plus wait to get a drink while waiting.  Left before eating. Management didn‚Äôt handle the situation properly. This place won‚Äôt last and probably only cool for instagram pictures.

NAME: JamieF
REVIEW: Soon as they iron out the kinks this place will be perfect! Food is amazing. Ambiance is great. Service could be better but that‚Äôs with any new restaurant opening. Bit rude and unorganized. Wait was over an hour for reservation but would try again in a few months

NAME: Nonna
REVIEW: We never got seated.  Completely ridiculous as a restaurant.

NAME: EssEm
REVIEW: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. I made reservations for 8 pm and showed up around 7:50. Keep in mind I‚Äôm writing this review at 11:48 pm. As I arrived with my party of 3 I was told they were clearing tables and we would be seated shortly. Several ppl showed up around the same time or a little after and was told the same thing. We checked back in with the host around 8:30 and was given the same robotic response. ‚ÄúWe have diners from 6:30 who just paid but haven‚Äôt gotten up yet‚Äù I watched as many ppl were told the same thing and grew angry as time passed.. Here‚Äôs the way the remainder of the night went:  9:45 pm seated where we placed complete orders 5 mins into being seated. 10:20 we received only one Caesar salad (ordered 2) 10:40 shrimp and lobster dumplings arrived. The owner comes over shortly after with a complimentary salad and dumplings.   We made sure to order main dishes at the same time of ordering appetizers. I expected the wait to be longer, however, by 11:30 we had grown tired of waiting. The owner Stratis Morfogen has to be the rudest person I‚Äôve ever met. He seemed unfazed by me expressing this had been the worst dining experience I‚Äôve ever had. He stated the food would be out in 2 mins. By minute 5 we decided to leave. We were also told we would be reimbursed for one round of drinks. It took them 10 minutes to refund $32, and again, the owner walked away in the middle of me asking why it was taking so long to refund $32. He instead decided to entertain a large party who were having drinks.  With that being said, I‚Äôd rather wait in the lobby of a Red Lobster for over an hour than to ever walk foot back into this overbooked overrated establishment.

NAME: MaureenM
REVIEW: Food was good, service awkward and lacked coordination. Second floor dining area poorly designed for patron and staff traffic flow. We watched people bumping into each other for our entire meal that began at 6:30pm. Owner, Stratis, was there moving things along, but it was still choppy, no pun intended. We will try again in a few months, after the holidays.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was fantastic! Service is great! We arrived about an hour earlier than our reservation time and they were able to seat us. The staff is friendly and welcoming. I highly suggest ordering their dumplings. Everything was great.

NAME: WestsideAndy
REVIEW: I decided to have brunch here after getting married at the courthouse just a few blocks north...it was the best decision ever. We both wanted to have lunch in a memorable dining location but not have to deal with an overcrowded and overly noisy location because there was so much we wanted to talk about with our loved ones after our civil ceremony. The manager and owner were so kind and nice, as were the wait staff and hostess. Everyone was great! We cannot wait to celebrate our anniversary here and would refer EVERYONE to dine here because the food is delicious. We will be back many times before our anniversary arrives.

NAME: AnnaL
REVIEW: So I made a reservation for 2 for Thursday night. The place was really busy but we were seated immediately, which was great. Tables for two were placed in the middle of already narrow room so there were waiter walking by us non stop the whole time we were there, which was about 2 hours. Also, the area where waiters congregated was also right next to our table so the swarm of them was walking back and forth and around through the entire evening. I mean, it was great not to wait for water to be refilled and table cleared, but damn! Too many people standing by our table all at the same time was a bit too much. Also, I didn't appreciate when our waiter asked that we order everything, apps and main course, at the same time since "they were getting really busy". I wanted another few minutes or so to study what seemed to be an interesting menu, but his insistence threw me off. I didn't like to be rushed, especially if it was my 1st time at this restaurant. By the time we left there were plenty of tables unoccupied, so his comment seemed weird. Now to the food... Philly cheese steak dumplings were fantastic! I really loved the dough; Cesar salad was nothing special and so wasn't my filet mignon sandwich (it said there were supposed to be onions in it and there weren't any..or I just couldn't see or taste them. Also, since I was rushed to make a descision, I didn't see that there was an extra charge for adding cheese. Again, I liked the bready part of the sandwich the most). The highlight of the meal, besides dumplings, was the lava cake. Delicious! Will I be back? Perhaps to try the rest of the dumplings...but then again, I live on UES and probably won't make the trip down town just to visit this spot again.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Every new restaurant has their hiccups but the service was exceptionally poor, and the food was dripping in grease. Not a pleasant experience, I will not be going back.

NAME: Boeku
REVIEW: It's my new favorite restaurant! I enjoyed everything about my experience. I'm gonna go there at least 3x a month.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: We had kids with us and the menu was perfect, along with the atmosphere.  GREAT place, congratulations!

NAME: Plongdiner
REVIEW: Really enjoyed our time there.  First time!  My daughter attends PACE and was really anxious for us to try this spot as location was RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET  and had replaced a really bad Dennys:)  Owner was super attentive to us as was our server..the dumplings are not to be missed and the dry aged steak pricing is the best I have seen in the city.  Nice Job BCHOP

NAME: SELENAM
REVIEW: This was my 2nd time at Brooklyn Chop House and I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll be back again! The food is delicious and I love the ambiance.

NAME: Tanie
REVIEW: The ribeye steak for two was delicious! I thought the ambiance was really nice for a birthday celebration.

NAME: Nicole
REVIEW: Exceeded all my expectations.. Omg if you love coconut the Lychee martini is a must have!!!

NAME: ZacharyS
REVIEW: Made a reservation for me and the GF at 9:30pm on Saturday (11/3/18). Got there right at 9:30, told our table wasn't quite ready yet. No problem, place was packed, really cool venue, happy to wait. A few minutes later another couple walks in, and a 2nd host seats them right away. He catches my eye when he comes back, I guess I looked a bit confused, and he says "you didn't want the table I gave them, very crowded, not a good spot, we're going to get you guys a much better table." Sure, ok, bit weird to condemn anything about a newly opened establishment you work in, but I figured I'd take his word for it. A good 10 minutes later, the hostess tells us to follow her, takes us upstairs to back of the restaurant, and stops, because there are no open tables to seat us. She apologizes, brings us back downstairs, parks us by the server's entrance to the bar, and disappears. Close to 15 minutes pass, and she reemerges and says "sorry, they're having coffee, and then we'll seat you," and then she disappears again. Doesn't offer us menus, doesn't offer even a drink while we wait, just vanishes again. At least another 10 minutes go by, and she finally comes back with menus, brings us back upstairs, and seats us AT THE TABLE RIGHT BEHIND THE COUPLE WHOSE TABLE "WE DIDN'T WANT" WHEN WE FIRST ARRIVED. The bus boys are still cleaning the table, putting down silverware, etc...when we sit. Hostess leaves menus, and walks away. A waiter shows up, doesn't introduce himself, and asks "what do you want to drink?" We were never given drink menus, which we informed him of. He goes "oh", and comes back with ONE drink menu. He leaves, only to come back 30 seconds later and ask again "what do you want to drink?" I told him we only got one drink menu, so we weren't ready yet, and he goes "oh", brings us a 2nd drink menu, and then leaves. And never comes back. We sat for 15 minutes, and no one ever came back to take our order. So we left.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This place was GREAT! Outstanding service from the time i walked in the door the host was very tentative and the bartenders as well. The food was like wow. I was impressed with the asian/american fusion. The cheesesteak dumplings!! AMAZING!! only thing we didn't like was our waiter was a little confused seemed like he had too many tables and had a little trouble with english. But everything else was so good along with the experience that it was a pleasure. We will surely return.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Excellent place. Cool staff. Great vibe

NAME: TinaCrownHeights
REVIEW: They kept us 20 minutes past our reservation time. (We learned from other diners that Open Table is not accurate.) We waited another 30 minutes before they took our order. We waited 20 minutes for our drinks and 45 minutes for our meal to arrive.  The house salad had no dressing. The Spicy Tuna roll was chewy. And the rare filet arrived well-done on a sizzling platter. We need to relieve the babysitter, so once the food arrived, asked for the check, which we received 15 minutes later. In addition to the slow service and the incorrect food items, the wait staff was noncommunicative and aggressively rude. We asked to check on our order and he reviewed his notepad to read back what we'd ordered, saying "it's on its way." That's not checking. To top it off, as we sat there at an empty table waiting, the managers (I think) kept asking "everything ok?" to the point where my husband said "No, we've been waiting sitting at this table for over an hour and don't have our food yet." We won't return.

NAME: GaryD
REVIEW: Had an excellent meal. All the food was really good.

NAME: JimM
REVIEW: The welcome from the host & hostess was perfect. They were friendly and inviting and "on top of it". The interior is very nice, too. The server knew his stuff & was very familiar with all of the specials and menu items. The wine tasting pours were very generous. The "upselling" was a bit too much, but certainly not pushy. I'd like to go back again soon.

NAME: Lewie
REVIEW: We live within 4 blocks in downtown NYC.  We were greeted warmly by Caleb and seated with Daniel. The service and attention was great.  Tried the French onion soup dumplings and the ribs. Dumpling was as anticipated, very nice.  Ribs were perfect for 2.  Had the chicken in black bean sauce which was succulent and satisfying along with shrimp fried rice for 2.  Overall we are happy a restaurant like this is here in our neighborhood!

NAME: DanielG
REVIEW: Average food. Poor service. Staff was not attentive despite the fact that the restaurant was not busy. Bad attitude to top it off. 20% tip added by default. Smart move because otherwise they would not get many tips.

NAME: delaponte
REVIEW: The servers and staff appeared to be slightly in cohesive with regards to information requested about the drink options. We had a really good time and the food was top notch.

NAME: Parker705
REVIEW: I was glad to discover this place and I will definitely try it again.  I found the service and menu to be a little confused.  For example their salads come in a wooden serving bowl placed on the table with one utensil (a large spoon) with which to serve yourself.    It is awkward and why go to this additional step?  Eventually salad dressing was provided for me, several tasty kinds, but with no explanation of what kinds they were.   Was I supposed to taste them to determine?  (which is what I ended up doing)  My friends' salad arrived dressed.  This is a small matter but it irks me when concept preempts practicality.

NAME: SteveF
REVIEW: newly opened. They need to get some procedures refined and improved

NAME: Steve
REVIEW: Very nice set-up.  The dumplings were very good.  Main course not so much.

NAME: OleS
REVIEW: Great place for lunch or dinner.  Went there for Sunday brunch with family. Very friendly and tentative staff. Fun menu and also great for kids. Food was great.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: This is NYC's newest destination restaurant. I loved everything about this  place from the ambiance, to the fine dining experience and music selection.

NAME: SteveC23
REVIEW: Brooklyn Chop House was Excellent, great drinks, food and a lot of fun.

NAME: Jeremy
REVIEW: This is a fantastic new restaurant. Very chic and hip ambience without being pretentious. The service was excellent and the food is really great and creative and delicious. Not too pricey for the quality. We had several of the offerings from the Chinese inspired part of the menu as well as a delicious piece of perfectly seared filet minion sliced and served with rice.  Drinks were great and the owner Stratis is such a gentleman. He was on the floor all night making sure all of his customers are happy and that the food is good and that the servers are taking care of you.  It's impressive to see the owner also operating as the floor manager and adding his personal touch. The menu may seem a little eclectic, but the dishes are a good complement each other very well. I will definitely go back and recommend to others. Try it!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Food was good. The wait for table and for food to come was long

NAME: DonnaP
REVIEW: Delicious food and drink.  Thoroughly enjoyed my meal.  Nice ambiance.

NAME: RobinR
REVIEW: We were excited to welcome a newcomer to the neighborhood but were bitterly disappointed.  The food was skimpy, tasteless, and unimaginative -- for example, browning iceberg lettuce for the house salad.  Our waiter was exorbitantly dilatory, and basically disappeared for the bizarrely long periods between servings.  The entrees did not come as described (missing onion, etc.); it was impossible to remedy these deficiencies in our orders because of the waiter's vanishing act. Our wine and cocktails were unremarkable.  The bill was ridiculous given the quantity and quality of the food we finally did receive.  It's supposed to be a chophouse but even the hamburger (two thin paddies) tasted like it was just defrosted.  The waiter never asked what type of salad dressing we wanted but brought out little tin cups for the table with indistinguishable fatty dressings we wouldn't have chosen.  One of our party requested oil and vinegar, and fifteen minutes later, he arrived with two tiny saucers.  The futility of getting his attention again made it too daunting to get more for the others who also wanted oil and vinegar but couldn't share in the minuscule portion.  This, when they're charging $50 for a steak.  We eat out frequently, and have lived in the neighborhood for ten years.  We especially love steakhouses and we have a lot of favorite local places.  But at the end of the evening at the Brooklyn Chop House, I felt the experience was disgusting to the point of false advertising. As far as me and my husband are concerned, they can't go out of business soon enough.

NAME: AlYC
REVIEW: I had a very good experience and time at Brooklyn Chop House. There were many stars and entertainers dining at the establishment and very affordable pricing!

NAME: Manhattanknight
REVIEW: What a bizarre place. We spent most of the time just laughing about the menu offerings. Pac Man Seafood was a hit! the Bacon Cheeseburger Dumplings were...strange. The steaks were perfect though - but the onion "side" was a lot more like a "pay a lot for a garnish". It was all just entirely amusing, including the rather novice seeming staff which fell over themselves trying to take away everyone's plates. We loved it for the hilarious conversation if nothing else - and the atmosphere is wonderful. Yeah, I'd go back!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: I had the most amazing time with my daughter, ringing in my birthday. The food is amazing. Hospitality is warm. Servers need to be more knowledgeable and confident in their spiels. Overall - I WILL BE DEF BE A REGULAR.

NAME: SamanthaC
REVIEW: Love the location definitely will be back and the drinks was good I recommend the spicy mango margarita and the hostess she was very nice

NAME: EricB
REVIEW: Super addition to neighborhood. Unusual steak house asian fusion. Uniques delicious soup dumplings. Wonderful staff

NAME: TribecaFind
REVIEW: No. This is like if your worst, most delusional acquaintance announced (with no experience) that they were opening a restaurant because it will be fun, and they ‚Äúknow food.‚Äù Saying this place is run by amateurs is an insult to amateurs everywhere. Stay away. Far.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The menu is a mix of Asian cuisine and American steakhouse! That alone is an amazing selection. My waiter Daniel was very nice and knowledgeable of the menu.He also gave great recommendations ! The chef gave us a complimentary dessert (3 flavors of ice cream) i told Daniel i appreciate it the ice cream but I‚Äôm lactose intolerant. Daniel bought me out some sorbet and it was delicious! We had the beef rib bao buns,lamb chops , chicken satay, and soft shell crab fried rice.(no complaints) The owner was close friends with biggie smalls (trust when u go, u will be able to tell)

NAME: MerisZ
REVIEW: Fun. Good for kids. Great service.  Outstanding soup dumplings.  Neighborhood friendly spot with great ambiance

NAME: Person
REVIEW: Great food, great meat. A little ghetto both in ambiance and patronage. The waiter approached the table on average every 5 min, but much more at the beginning (like every 3 min). We felt rushed and ended up making quick decisions on food just to try to keep him away for a little bit. Overall it's a good place for people watching (the partons), and great steak/dumplings. I wouldn't recommend it if you're attempting to impress someone who's at all refined, or if you are yourself (I was embarrassed to have made the recommendation). BUT, the food was really good, and now knowing what it is, I'd go back by myself, maybe at a time where it's probably not going to be busy.

NAME: TrevorS
REVIEW: Excellent location. The food was amazing. The salt and pepper shrimp are perfect so was the wait staff. Truly appreciate this brand new gem. I will be back.

NAME: HarryH
REVIEW: I had one of the best steaks I've ever had there - the Porterhouse for 2...and great to pair it with healthier Asian style veggie options rather than the typical potatoes...thanks Brooklyn Chop House!

NAME: WhitneyB
REVIEW: Was very excited to try this as I live down the street and am always looking for great new go-to spots. Food was extremely average and service was dismal-getting drinks was like waiting for snow to melt and our server forgot several things when they finally did show up. Ambiance is also very odd, a friend told me it used to be a Denny‚Äôs prior to becoming BCH and I 100% believe that. Highly suggest skipping.

NAME: JenniferB
REVIEW: Unique menu offering a variety of Asian/steakhouse fusion with a multitude of options...from French onion soup dumplings to short ribs to seafood. Great variety and cannot wait to return to try additional items

NAME: katiem
REVIEW: We walked in and loved what we saw already! They have a nice bar area where people can hangout with a cocktail and relax. I loved everything we ordered and our waiter was very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed! We will definitely be going back asap!! Its our new to-go- to place!!

NAME: RALRSL
REVIEW: Mediocre at best! Dissapointing waited for opening and once opened very disappointed.  Unusual menu for restaurant with chop house in name! Should decide what it wants to be when it grows up. The side room at lower level is also terrible if you go sit upstairs.

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: The entire dining experience was amazing. The restaurants decor is beautiful, the customer service was on point, the drinks & dinner were impeccable. I‚Äôll definitely be back very soon!! I can see this restaurant doing well and being open for years to come!! Thank you Brooklyn Chop House!

NAME: MerisZ
REVIEW: Service was very friendly and helpful. A little slow as waiter was dealing with multiple tables.  Food was fun; we had dim sum. Wine very good.  Didn‚Äôt care for the pac man dumplings.  However, the pork soup dumplings were delicious. As it is steps from my apt building, I will be a frequent guest.  I don‚Äôt want to forget mentioning that my grandson loved his caramel ice cream with caramel sauce; whipped cream wasn‚Äôt good.  Looking forward to my next visit where I plan on trying one of your meat or fish entrees. So happy that you are here!

NAME: OpenTable Diner
REVIEW: Spinach salad was just a bowl of spinach dumped into a bowl. Nothing else.  Chicken satay was uneatable.
